name: Broccoli
climate: Broccoli thrives in cooler temperatures and can withstand frost conditions.
It prefers a climate where the temperature ranges between 18-24Â°C during the day.
In warmer regions, broccoli should be planted for late fall or early spring harvest.
High temperatures can lead to bolting, which affects the quality of the heads.
sunlight: Broccoli requires full sunlight for at least 6 to 8 hours a day to grow well.
In regions with intense sunlight, partial shade may help prevent premature bolting.
If grown in shade, broccoli plants may become leggy and not produce good heads.
Proper sunlight ensures compact and healthy broccoli head development.
watering: Broccoli needs consistent moisture, so watering should occur regularly.
Avoid letting the soil dry out completely; this can stress the plant.
Overwatering should be avoided as it can lead to root rot diseases.
Watering at the base helps prevent waterborne plant diseases on leaves.
soil: It grows best in rich, well-drained soil with a pH between 6.0 and 7.0.
Amending the soil with organic matter like compost enhances growth.
Soil should retain moisture but also allow for proper drainage to avoid rot.
Broccoli prefers fertile soil; test and adjust pH levels for best results.
extra_care_tip: To improve head quality, apply a layer of mulch to conserve moisture.
